title: Hash Rate - Ep 114 - Is dTAO Working? Expert Panel

rawLines.text: Hello everybody and welcome to hash
rate. Today we have a very special show.
We're going to do a panel for the very
first time. So my guests today are
Michael White of BitTensorf fund 1,
Keith Singery of tow.com, BitTensor Guru
Podcast and Subnet 81 Patrol and David
Fields of Subnet 33 Ready AI. Hello
gentlemen. How are you all doing? What's
up Mark? How are you? Thank you for
being here. Thanks for having us, Mark.
Yeah, thanks for having us on. All
right, so let's get to the first
exciting question of the day. So,
Dynamic Tao, otherwise known as DTA,
launched roughly 90 days ago, and this
is a system whereby every subnet now has
its own alpha token, which can be
obtained by staking. The market cap of
the subnet dictates how much Tao
emissions are then routed to that
particular subnet and to subnet token
holders. Now the idea behind this was to
let the market decide which subnets are
worthy of tow emissions and thus improve
the quality of AI projects in the bit
tensor ecosystem. Question is this
system working? What's working and
what's not? I'm going to throw it to
David first. What are your thoughts on
this?
Yeah, so um you know we've we've
obviously talked a little bit about this
you know over the last you know few
weeks. Um I think taking sort of a a
longer term perspective you know for the
first 90 100 days you know here um
pretty incredible you know I think there
uh was a was a significant you know uh
technical hurdle to sort of get over uh
with launching um I think we saw very
minimal kind of problems in the in the

you know kind of challenges I think
could have developed that really did not
um now I sort of think that you know my
my biggest sort of perspective here is
okay we actually now have real data we

most of what you're seeing with activity

is still very like low liquidity

there's not substantial updates or or

25%. So there there's very little
